answers.answer: Hello and welcome to the forums : )I'm glad you found us and hope you find the site helpful and supportive.I'm sorry you are dealing with multiple heart problems and that you are not feeling well. I am not a doctor, but given your history, I would suggest you touch base with your doctor and explain your new symptoms.  If it a side effect from the medication(s), there are alternative therapies.  Give your doctor a chance to assess the situation and determine if he/she will need to see you in the office.Hope you're feeling better very soon!connie

question: I am a 50 yr. old woman with a history of CHF, High Blood Pressure, Diabetes, Heart Dease and just had a stent put in heart valve in October for a 99 0/0 blockage and have a 40 - 50 0\0  blockage remaining.I take my medications, but recently have begun to have chest pain again, increased (continual) heartburn (dispite taking Prilosac daily),  and when I eat or drink and go to swollow it feels as though there is something in the middle of my chest stopping the swollow.My question is...should I be concerned about these things or are these normal side effects of meds I am taking?
title: Heart Stent/CHF
